greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is least number k such that k/P > P^n, with n and P (=P(k)) as in A051283.
example: a(3) = 27720 = 2^3 * 3^2 * 5^1 * 7^1 * 11^1 as P = 11^1 and 27720/11 = 2520 > 11^3 = 1331 and no number k less than 27720 has k/P > P^3 for its corresponding P.
program: (PARI) a(n) = for(k=2, oo, f=factor(k); if(#f~>n+1 && k>vecmax(vector(#f~, i, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2]))^(n+1), return(k))); \\ _Jinyuan Wang_, Feb 28 2020
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jul 31 2005
